text:
Aparium to convert Kansas City’s Pabst and Pendergast buildings
Kansas City architecture firm El Dorado Inc. has been selected to design the new hotel, which is scheduled to open in mid-2017. Work on the conversion project will start early next year.
Chicago-based Aparium acquired the adjacent buildings, in the city’s Crossroads Arts District, for the project, which will include a restaurant, a bar and lounge, meeting spaces and a rooftop deck.
Aparium plans to meet with local brewers, distilleries, vendors and farmers to come up with a name that will “resonate with locals while paying homage to the properties’ Prohibition-era heritage”.
Source:-Boutique Hotel
